definition: to ward off (a blow)/to withstand/to defend
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: But the country has every intention of safeguarding its food supply.
sentences.chinese: 但是中国已经在竭力捍卫其粮食供应。

sentences.english: And if you are English, you'd avidly defend your words.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是英国人，你会迫切地要捍卫你的文字。

sentences.english: Who decides why we live and why we die to defend.
sentences.chinese: 谁决定了我们生存的理由和誓死捍卫之事？

sentences.english: Are journalists lovable rogues or human-rights crusaders?
sentences.chinese: 他们到底是可爱的流氓还是人权的捍卫者？

sentences.english: Los Blancos should support the coach and his players to death.
sentences.chinese: 白衣军团应当誓死捍卫他们的球员和教练。

sentences.english: Comprehensive does the CPC intelligence security work.
sentences.chinese: 全面揭密中共情报捍卫工作。

sentences.english: But this defense of faith faces a steep hurdle.
sentences.chinese: 但是捍卫信仰面临着一道险峻的屏障。

sentences.english: Mr. Obama spoke, unwaveringly , of the need to defend the country's security and values.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马先生坚定地说，必须捍卫国家的安全和价值观。

sentences.english: Merkin 's lawyer said he intended to defend the lawsuit vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔金先生的律师说，他打算捍卫大力诉讼。

sentences.english: We must safeguard our state territorial integrity.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须捍卫我们领土的完整。

sentences.english: Koch Industries zealously guards its public image.
sentences.chinese: 科赫公司热衷于捍卫其公众形象。

sentences.english: Moggi is spending all his available time defending himself.
sentences.chinese: 莫吉用他所有的时间去捍卫自己。

sentences.english: The United States is committed to defending religious freedom around the world.” --Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton
sentences.chinese: 美国坚定不移地捍卫世界各地的宗教自由。

sentences.english: We stand together to defend democracy.
sentences.chinese: 我们站在一起捍卫民主。

sentences.english: So how does the case in defence of democracy stand up these days?
sentences.chinese: 那么，当今捍卫民主的战况如何？

sentences.english: Now, I have long been a vigorous defender of free markets.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我一直是自由市场的有力捍卫者。

definition: to defend/to safeguard/to protect/to uphold/to maintain
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to hold fast to/to stick to
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
solid as a boulder (idiom); absolutely secure/rock-firm and unyielding
